clinical_study.brief_title: Technology-Supported Treatment of Sleep Apnea in Prediabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Technology-Supported Treatment of Sleep Apnea in Prediabetes

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

brief_summary.textblock: Despite the efficacy of intensive lifestyle interventions in prediabetes, the incidence of diabetes is rising, and thus there is a critical need for additional strategies to prevent diabetes and to reduce its cardiovascular complications in this high-risk population. Sleep apnea is a highly common condition in prediabetes, but it has been mostly ignored and undertreated in current practice. The proposed study will be the first to assess whether adding CPAP (continuous positive air pressure) treatment to a lifestyle intervention improves cardiometabolic outcomes beyond that achieved with lifestyle alone (i.e. current standard of care) in high-risk individuals with prediabetes.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a 6-month randomized controlled, parallel group trial with two arms. After baseline, the subjects will be randomized to lifestyle intervention alone (lifestyle group) or lifestyle plus CPAP intervention (lifestyle plus CPAP group). The same metabolic and cardiovascular assessments will be performed at baseline and after 6-months of intervention.
The lifestyle group will aim to achieve a weight loss through diet and exercise. The lifestyle plus CPAP group will additionally receive CPAP treatment. All subjects will use a custom smartphone app to track weight loss and/or CPAP goals and will receive weekly coaching phone calls to maximize treatment adherence.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline 2-hour glucose levels at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Glucose levels will be measured at time=120min during oral glucose tolerance test

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline morning blood pressure at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Morning blood pressure will be measured with a blood pressure cuff while sitting

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline fasting glucose levels at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Fasting blood glucose levels will be measured in the morning

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline 24-hour blood pressure at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour blood pressure will be measured using and ambulatory blood pressure device

intervention.description: All participants will receive diet and exercise goals and coaching.
CPAP treatment for sleep apnea and CPAP education and adherence coaching.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Overweight or obese
- Prediabetes
- Sleep apnea
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetic
- enrolled in a formal weight loss program
- Any underlying disease likely to limit life span and/or increase risk of interventions
